content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function. If <math alttext="h of x, equals, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following gives a correct process for finding <math alttext="h prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis, times, f prime of 3 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis, times, f prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis, times, f prime of 3 x, times 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="h prime of x, equals, 2 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus, f of 3 x, close parenthesis, times, f prime of 3 x, times 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
